modules.description: This module provides an asynchronous `decode` function that processes character streams into integer streams using a specified encoding. It works with `Markup.Encoding.t` encodings, character streams, and location/error reporting callbacks that return Lwt promises. Concrete use cases include decoding HTML or XML content from network sources in web scraping or server-side processing where asynchronous I/O is required.

This module enables asynchronous parsing and generation of XML and HTML, stream-based data transformation, and encoding management with error handling, operating on character streams, Markup parsers, and XML trees. It supports use cases like web scraping, server-side document processing, and streaming data conversion with non-blocking I/O, including the ability to build XML structures using custom node constructors for flexible tree manipulation.

This module provides functions to convert between Lwt IO channels and byte streams, enabling asynchronous reading from and writing to files and channels. It supports concrete operations like streaming bytes from a file or channel, and writing byte streams to output channels or files. Use cases include processing large files asynchronously or handling network IO streams without blocking.
